New Records: Rohit Sharma retired hurt after being hit on the shoulder and Rishabh Pant was whacked on the elbow, arm, chest and glove.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 1 run in 3 overs.
Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Match.
Rohit Sharma scored a scruffy but important half-century from 36 balls.
Key Match Events: India won by eight wickets with 46 balls remaining.
Rohit Sharma retired hurt after being hit on the shoulder.
Rishabh Pant was whacked on the elbow, arm, chest and glove.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 1 run in 3 overs.
Suryakumar Yadav was caught by Dockrell off White for 2 runs.
India's quicks were just too good, certainly on this pitch.
Ireland's batters struggled with the lateral movement and swing of the ball.
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma said that they didn't know what the pitch would be like and wanted to bowl first.
Ireland captain Paul Stirling said that the toss played a crucial part and that India bowled terrific lengths.
India have all the tools to win the competition, but having the tools has never been the problem.
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma said that they didn't enjoy batting on a pitch that was at best duplicitous and at worst dangerous.
Ireland captain Paul Stirling said that they needed to put pressure back on the Indian bowlers but kept losing wickets.
Jasprit Bumrah said that he will never complain when the ball is doing quite a bit and there is good bounce and pace.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The ICC have a problem with this New York pitch, especially as India play Pakistan here on Sunday.
The pitch was at best duplicitous and at worst dangerous.
India's seamers were intimidatingly good, certainly on this pitch.
Ireland's batters struggled to cope with the swing and seam movement of the ball.
